docs.doc: Companion Network demonstrates agent-to-agent coordination eliminating "coordination tax". Built for MCP Hackathon, Kaggle AI Agents Intensive, and Google Gemini Award. Two personal AI Companions communicate via Google's A2A Protocol and MCP to negotiate availability and coordinate plans.
Technical Type: Hybrid (Web App + Developer Tool). Domain: Consumer / General. Complexity: Low. Dual deliverables: Gradio Demo (web app) and Companion Framework (developer tool).

Core coordination flow with two Companion agents, basic availability checking, event proposal flow, A2A communication. Split-screen Gradio application with chat interfaces and network activity monitor. Pre-configured user context for demo.

Manual setup with modern tooling. Installation commands for uv (Windows PowerShell and macOS/Linux curl). Virtual environment creation with uv venv. Core dependencies: google-adk, mcp[cli], gradio, python-dotenv.
Prerequisites: Python 3.10+, uv, Google AI Studio API key. Setup commands include uv installation, venv creation, dependency installation, .env file creation, and project structure initialization.

Runtime: Python 3.10+. AI Framework: Google ADK v1.19.0+, Gemini 2.5 Pro. Communication: MCP Python SDK v1.22.0, HTTP/JSON-RPC 2.0. UI: Gradio (latest stable). Data: SQLite 3, Python dataclasses. Development: uv for package management.
